com.epoch.utils

Class SortUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.utils.SortUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppConstants

    public final class SortUtils
extends Object
implements AppConstants
    Methods for sorting objects that are not comparable into an order given by one or more String or Integer keys that are themselves comparable.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.epoch.constants.AppConstants

    • Method Detail

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • sort

        public static void sort(Object[] toSort,
                        Comparable<?>[] keys)
                 throws ParameterException
        Orders an array of nonunique objects in the order given by keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original arrays by sorting them both, the keys according to their natural order and the objects according to the order of the keys.
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of keys to use to sort the objects
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the lists don't have the same length

      • sort

        public static void sort(Object[] toSort,
                        Comparable<?>[] keys,
                        String language)
                 throws ParameterException
        Orders an array of nonunique objects in the order given by keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original arrays by sorting them both, the keys according to their natural order and the objects according to the order of the keys.
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of keys to use to sort the objects
        language - language to use for alphabetization
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the lists don't have the same length

      • sort

        public static <T> void sort(List<T> toSort,
                            List<Comparable<?>> keys)
                     throws ParameterException
        Orders a list of nonunique objects in the order given by keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original lists by sorting them both, the keys according to their natural order and the objects according to the order of the keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of Object being sorted
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of keys to use to sort the objects
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the lists don't have the same length

      • sort

                            List<Comparable<?>> keys,
                            String language)
                     throws ParameterException
        Orders a list of nonunique objects in the order given by keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original lists by sorting them both, the keys according to their natural order and the objects according to the order of the keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of Object being sorted

      • sort

        public static void sort(Object[] toSort,
                        Comparable<?>[][] keys)
                 throws ParameterException
        Orders an array of nonunique objects in the order given by an array of two or more keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original arrays.
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of arrays of keys to use to sort the objects
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the object and key arrays don't have the same length or some keys don't have the same length

      • sort

        public static void sort(Object[] toSort,
                        Comparable<?>[][] keys,
                        String language)
                 throws ParameterException
        Orders an array of nonunique objects in the order given by an array of two or more keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original arrays.
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of arrays of keys to use to sort the objects
        language - language to use for alphabetization
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the object and key arrays don't have the same length or some keys don't have the same length

      • sortByArrays

        public static <T> void sortByArrays(List<T> toSort,
                                    List<Comparable<?>[]> keys)
                             throws ParameterException
        Orders a list of nonunique objects in the order given by arrays of two or more keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original lists, preserving the original key arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of Object being sorted
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of keys to use to sort the objects
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the lists don't have the same length or some key arrays don't have the same length

      • sortByArrays

        public static <T> void sortByArrays(List<T> toSort,
                                    List<Comparable<?>[]> keys,
                                    String language)
                             throws ParameterException
        Orders a list of nonunique objects in the order given by arrays of two or more keys (Comparables) that may also not be unique. Modifies both original lists, preserving the original key arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of Object being sorted
        Parameters:
        toSort - list of objects to sort
        keys - parallel list of keys to use to sort the objects
        language - language to use for alphabetization
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if the lists don't have the same length or some key arrays don't have the same length

      • sortLists

        private static void sortLists(List<ArrayList<Comparable<?>>> lists,
                              RuleBasedCollator localized)
        Sorts the list of lists of values. Each list is sorted by each element in turn. If each list has three or more members, and at least two lists have a common first member, this method will be called recursively.
        Parameters:
        lists - list of list of comparable values
        localized - a collator for a location given by the sorting language

      • sortOneMemberLists

        private static void sortOneMemberLists(List<ArrayList<Comparable<?>>> oneElemLists,
                                       RuleBasedCollator localized)
        Sorts a list of one-member lists according to the values of their single members. We can't change the values of the lists or make new ones; we need to reorder all the original objects.
        Parameters:
        oneElemLists - a list of one-member lists
        localized - a collator for a location given by the sorting language

      • sort

        private static void sort(List<Comparable<?>> list,
                         RuleBasedCollator localized)
        Sorts a list of Comparables that are Strings or Integers, modifying the original object.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of Comparables
        localized - a collator for a location given by the sorting language

      • checkNulls

        private static void checkNulls(List<Comparable<?>> list)
                        throws ParameterException
        Checks that every member of a list is not null.
        Parameters:
        list - a list
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if a member is null

      • checkLengthsAndNulls

        private static void checkLengthsAndNulls(List<Comparable<?>[]> list)
                                  throws ParameterException
        Checks that every array in a list has the same length and that no member of any array is null.
        Parameters:
        list - a list of arrays
        Throws:
        ParameterException - if some arrays don't have the same length or a member is null

      • getCollator

        private static RuleBasedCollator getCollator(String language)
        Returns a collator for a language, based on a particular location given by a language.
        Parameters:
        language - the language
        Returns:
        a collator based on the language's location
